programmes.show_description: You Have Just Been Murdered: Steed and Peel find themselves embroiled in a blackmail scheme that targets millionaires. Can they solve the case before someone really is killed?
To Market, To Market: Hawkeye and Trapper discover that important medical supplies have been hijacked in Seoul by black marketeers, so they meet with the head of the marketing ring.
Requiem for a Lightweight: Hot Lips becomes jealous of Lt Margie Cutler, for whose affection Hawkeye and Trapper are both competing.
Chief Surgeon Who?: Hawkeye is named chief surgeon of the 4077th, to the great chagrin of Major Frank Burns. Jamie Farr is introduced as the cross-dressing Corporal Maxwell Q. Klinger.
Different Answers: Helen and Phil are keen for Laura and Mike get on, but when they ask each one separately how they like the other and what happened after they left the party.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
A Special Love: Part 1: Jonathan and Mark try to persuade a young man with Down's Syndrome to take part in the Special Olympics. Scotty and Diane learn whether or not they can have children.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
A Special Love: Part 2: Scotty and Diane are determined to adopt Todd, but Todd's parents won't agree. Both sides are prepared to fight it out in court.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.

Oh Lucky Man: Mark puts Jonathan and Brady out of the picture after he wins a substantial amount of money. He also falls in love with Nina who is broke but doesn't know it.
It's Christmas and Jonathan and Mark's assignment is to show a cynical columnist named Basinger that there's still some good out there.

programmes.show_name: New: Little House On The Prairie
programmes.show_description: Gambini The Great: Ageing circus daredevil Gambini the Great has a hypnotic effect on the children of Walnut Grove, especially Albert and Willie.

programmes.show_name: New: Little House On The Prairie
programmes.show_description: The Legend Of Black Jake: A pair of bumbling crooks kidnap Nels and hold him for ransom. However, Mrs Olesen refuses to pay the $100 fee required to free her husband.

programmes.show_name: New: Little House On The Prairie
programmes.show_description: Chicago: Charles travels to Chicago to comfort his grief-stricken friend, Mr Edwards, after young newspaper reporter John Jr dies in what appears to be a tragic streetcar accident.
The Woman: John and Olivia are preparing to celebrate their 20th wedding anniversary, and John-Boy begins to make plans with an older woman, whom he falls in love with.
The Venture: The family may lose its considerable investment in a new business when John is hospitalised with pneumonia.
Chinese Whispers: The presence of strangers in town causes consternation for those with something to hide. Father Clifford struggles to control his feelings when he hears Assumpta may leave.
Destiny: Part 1: TV John's long-lost brother Kenneth is sprung from a South American jail by a millionaire who has heard that Kenneth knows where to find the legendary Stone of Destiny.
A Delicate Balance: Dr Finlay has serious concerns about the cause of death of one of his patients. Meanwhile, Dr Neil doubts his abilities when he has to revise his diagnosis of a patient.
Rumpole and Portia: Rumpole represents a scrap dealer accused of selling weapons to terrorists. But how will Rumpole fare when the case goes before a familiar figure?
The Moose: Hawkeye gets incensed when he learns Sgt Baker has purchased a 17-year-old girl from her family to be his 'Moose', or personal slave.
Yankee Doodle Doctor: The 4077th is asked to participate in a documentary film featuring 'false heroics.' Hawkeye and Trapper make their own movie after discovering that it's Army propaganda.
Bananas, Crackers and Nuts: Hawkeye and Trapper decide that they need some R and R after an unusually long stretch in surgery. They agree that Hawkeye should feign insanity to fool Frank.
Comic capers with Sid James, Diana Coupland, Terry Scott and June Whitfield. The Abbots have new neighbours - but will they get on like a house on fire or will fence lines become battle lines? (1972)
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Comic capers with Sid James, Diana Coupland, Terry Scott and June Whitfield. The Abbots have new neighbours - but will they get on like a house on fire or will fence lines become battle lines? (1972)
K Is For Kill Part 2: Tiger By The Tail: With many of the assailants accounted for, the team are faced with tracking down the surviving agents before they start World War III. Part 2 of 2.
Murdersville: Peel finds herself in a picturesque village while searching for her missing friend, Major Croft. But will Peel unearth the truth about the villagers before she gets in danger?
The Moose: Hawkeye gets incensed when he learns Sgt Baker has purchased a 17-year-old girl from her family to be his 'Moose', or personal slave.
Yankee Doodle Doctor: The 4077th is asked to participate in a documentary film featuring 'false heroics.' Hawkeye and Trapper make their own movie after discovering that it's Army propaganda.
Bananas, Crackers and Nuts: Hawkeye and Trapper decide that they need some R and R after an unusually long stretch in surgery. They agree that Hawkeye should feign insanity to fool Frank.
Success Story: Matthew is delighted when Henry's successful younger brother Edward comes to stay. But will Henry be proud or envious of his sibling's achievements?
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
For The Love Of Larry: A precocious dog tries to lead Jonathan and Mark to his owners who are trapped in a car at the bottom of a hill.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Another Kind Of War, Another Kind Of Peace: Jonathan informs Mr. Clancy that his son who died in Vietnam fathered a child. He reluctantly takes in his grandson but refuses to bond with him.
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.

All That Glitters: When a major fire threatens a neighbourhood, Jonathan and Mark, in the guise of priests, re-open an abandoned church as a shelter.
Wally: Jonathan and Mark's latest assignment is Wally, a lovable elderly hobo and street puppeteer who's caring and good nature have made him, without his knowing it, an angel.

programmes.show_name: New: Little House On The Prairie
programmes.show_description: For The Love Of Nancy: A young boy is mercilessly teased at school for being overweight. However, Nancy decides to go easy on him - but does she have an ulterior motive to be nice?

programmes.show_name: New: Little House On The Prairie
programmes.show_description: Wave Of The Future: Mrs. Oleson is convinced that reopening Nellie's Restaurant and Hotel is a good idea, but is she prepared for the competition?

programmes.show_name: New: Little House On The Prairie
programmes.show_description: A Christmas They Never Forgot: Snowbound on Christmas Eve, Caroline, Laura and Hester Sue share memories of Christmases past.
The Sermon: When Walton Mountain's only schoolteacher and its minister suddenly decide to get married, John-Boy has to give the Sunday sermon.
The Genius: The Walton household is upset when John-Boy brings home a teenage college student genius with a photographic memory.
...Christmas Special: Assumpta's having a party, Quigley's trying to escape from the mother-in-law, and Father Clifford is having a lonely Christmas.
Destiny: Part 2: Hamish and friends trek across the mountains to rescue John. While Hamish and Isobel's relationship begins to blossom, John's fate proves to be much darker.
Childsplay: Back on duty after his accident, Dr Finlay is intrigued when a teenage girl brings her sisters to Arden House. Dr Neil becomes emotionally involved in the case of a dying patient.
Rumpole and the Quality of Life: Rumpole works alongside Ballard to defend Lady Perdita Derwent who is accused of murdering her husband. Meanwhile, Hilda forces Rumpole to go on a diet.
Cowboy: Cowboy, the helicopter pilot, shakes off his own injuries due to his anxieties about an overdue letter from his wife. He fears she's left him for another man and plans to return home.
Henry, Please Come Home: The surgeons will do anything to get Colonel Henry Blake back when he is transferred to Tokyo and Frank starts imposing military discipline on the camp.
I Hate a Mystery: Colonel Blake, Trapper and Hot Lips all have valuable articles stolen. The camp is searched and everything is found in Hawkeye's locker.
Action comedy with Robert De Niro and Charles Grodin. A bounty hunter is hired to get a bail-jumping Mob accountant to LA. But as enemies close in, can they survive the chase - and each other? (1988)
An uplifting round-up of good news stories from the UK and around the world.
Action comedy with Robert De Niro and Charles Grodin. A bounty hunter is hired to get a bail-jumping Mob accountant to LA. But as enemies close in, can they survive the chase - and each other? (1988)
Classic 80s comedy starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Danny DeVito. Can a 'perfect' human specimen and a pint-sized crook teach each other a thing or two on a wild quest to find their mother? (1988)
